City Council
On April 6, 1971, Waxahachie became a home-rule city. In Texas, any city with a population of 5,000 or more may become a home-rule city by establishing its own charter and submitting it to voters for approval. There are over 300 home-rule cities in Texas. Although each has its own charter, home-rule cities are subject to certain state and federal laws.

The Waxahachie City Council is a five-member body that is elected at large by the citizens. The Council Members serve staggered two-year terms. Each May, the Council appoints the mayor and mayor pro tem.

Meetings occur bi-monthly on the first and third Mondays at 7:00 p.m. in the Council Chambers at 401 S. Rogers.

Mail for the Mayor and City Council can be addressed to P.O. Box 757, Waxahachie, TX 75168.

Member/Term Expiration
Billie Wallace, Council Member Place 4, Mayor (05/2025)
Chris Wright, Council Member Place 3, Mayor Pro Tem (05/2026)
Tres Atkins, Council Member Place 1 (05/2026)
Patrick Souter, Council Member Place 2 (05/2026)
Travis Smith, Council Member Place 5 (05/2025)
City Attorney
Terry Welch, City Attorney
